column4: hmm, i cant boot my ubuntu box. some shell is showing up. now ibooted the ubuntucd, ran fsck and did not find any error. any ideas?
is your install full or frg?
frg? my installation is some weeks old and the sys was running fine.
with frugal, just get rid of all your session-files
and ensure that linux is in frugal setup on one of the secondary drives (not C:)
what is frugal? was it the answer to me? i did not insztall ubuntu in ntfs, if that is frugal
frugal install is when you have it in .sfs's that are mounted into a "no-emulation" img
fine, but do you have any ideas what i could try to find the problem why my ubuntu 10.04lts64 is not starting any longer?
if your install is frugal, try to delete .2fs or .3fs or w/e session files
as you are on ntfs, your install obviously contains of .sfs's
i just booted the standard ubuntu64bit cd. i assume i am not using frugar
LiveCD IS frugal
m installation is not booting. so why should i delete temporary files during the live-session?
my
mahloo, it's not possible in most cases to grab src off bin
Delete sessionfiles of your usual install
they are usually .2fs or something - refer to ubuntu wiki or UnionFS wiki
did you delete your 2fs?
Haha, you ubuntu people use frugal install without knowing what it is!
and, why does Puppy's eth# setup go easier than that in Ubuntu?
i think you misread my problem. so i reinstalled grub and retried booting . . . still waiting for the system, but it stays black after grub
